stix:STIX_Header.stix:Title: Multiple Sites Redirected to Fiesta Exploit Kit
stix:STIX_Header.stix:Description: On 30 March 2015, a financial sector user was referred to the site americanwx.com, then redirected to yoursophs.com, which redirected to mefastmap.eu and the malicious Adobe Flash video, hpeiqyg904.swf (MD5: 43d3699614f6a844a22a9f54d5ea70f4). This malware was identified as the Fiesta Exploit Kit. The activity was associated with the Kovter click-fraud campaign.

stix:Indicator.indicator:Description:
The domain americanwx.com resolved to IP 141.101.125.92 at the time of the report.
This compromised site contains malicious JavaScript, which is only visible upon hitting the site indirectly from an accepted referrer such as Google. The JavaScript redirects to yoursophs.com, which again redirects to a landing page at mefastmap.eu.
This domain resolved to IP 136.243.224.9 at the time of the report. The site americanwx.com redirected to yoursophs.com, which then redirected to mefastmap.eu.

Users were redirected to this site from yoursophs.com. The following GET request was observed:
GET /pve7s23q/5052a91a7f3a155a00060c09530205560d060d09555b015a0005040b56085505;130000;206 HTTP/1.1 Accept: */* Accept-Language: en-US Referer: http://mefastmap.eu/pve7s23q/Dwmdc7eVZnCqcvP-L-gW x-flash-version: 13,0,0,206 Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; MSIE 10.0; Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; Trident/6.0) Host: mefastmap.eu DNT: 1 Via: 1.1 localhost.localdomain 0AEC940B
HTTP/1.1 200 OK Server: nginx/1.4.4 Date: Mon, 30 Mar 2015 15:55:10 GMT Content-Type: application/x-shockwave-flash Content-Length: 10341 Connection: close Last-Modified: Mon, 30 Mar 2015 15:55:10 GMT Content-Disposition: inline; filename=hpeiqyg904.swf
The site mefastmap.eu contains obfuscated, malicious JavaScript that assesses the victim machine then delivers an exploit based on enumerated parameters. In the observed instance, an Adobe Flash exploit was delivered. There was no payload delivery identified during this instance.
The Fiesta Exploit Kit has been observed to deliver Kovter click-fraud malware. Kovter has functions to deter execution in virtual machines, and when encountered the exploit kit was running in a virtual machine environment.
This malware was identified as the Fiesta Exploit Kit used to exploit the Adobe Flash vulnerability CVE-2014-8440. It was downloaded from http://mefastmap.eu/pve7s23q/Dwmdc7eVZnCqcvP-L-gW.
